notes: Amazon/120 Series (1956-1970, 1950s coverage). Named Amazon in Sweden, exported as 122S beginning in 1958. Rear-wheel drive with inline-4 engines. Three-box design influenced by American cars of the era. Introduced many safety innovations including three-point seatbelt. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo Amazon article, January 2025 revision.

PV544 (1958-1965, 1950s coverage). Evolution of PV444 with updated styling and more powerful engines. Fastback 2-door sedan design. Rear-wheel drive with inline-4 engines. Rally success in 1960s. Replaced by Amazon/120 Series. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo PV444/544 article, January 2025 revision.

P1900 sports roadster (1956-1957). Volvo's first sports car with fiberglass body. Limited production of only 68 units. Rear-wheel drive with inline-4 engine. Discontinued due to quality issues and poor sales. Extremely rare, requires vintage restoration expertise. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo P1900 article, January 2025 revision.

Duett (1953-1969, 1950s coverage). Commercial vehicle based on PV444/544 platform. Available as panel van or passenger wagon. Rear-wheel drive with inline-4 engines. Dual-purpose design for commercial and family use. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo Duett article, January 2025 revision.
